{"id":1404175722,"question_id":201,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 months, 1 week","timestamp":1727459352,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1404175722/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Bitwise AND of Numbers Range","memory":"10.3 MB","code":"/*\nGiven two integers left and right that represent the range [left, right], return the bitwise AND of all numbers in this range, inclusive.\n0 <= left <= right <= 231 - 1\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    int rangeBitwiseAnd(int left, int right) {\n        while( right > left) {\n            //When we do an AND bit operation between number and number - 1, the rightmost bit of one in the original number would be turned off (from one to zero).\n            //Bitwise-AND of any two numbers will always produce a number less than or equal to the smaller number.\n            right = right & (right - 1);\n        };\n        return right & left;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"bitwise-and-of-numbers-range","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
